item.title: MetaCX: Transforming Suppliers & Buyers Collaboration
item.content:encoded:
More Details Coming soon…

Navigating ambiguous problem space in B2B SaaS startup. I am defining user problems to solve through the creation of personas and informing product roadmap through creative research methods.

Keywords

User Persona, Product Management, User Stories, User Interviews

item.title: IoT for Agriculture: Remote Beehive Monitoring
item.description: Foudational Research for a Student Start-up
item.content:encoded:
Project Summary

HiveTec is an early-stage start-up focusing on using technology as a solution to agricultural problems. HiveTec is developing an IoT-based remote monitoring tool for beehives to combat high honeybee colony loss.

As the primary UX researcher, I conducted a two-month foundational research project to understand U.S. beekeepers’ working processes, challenges, and needs with regards to monitoring beehives and keep bees healthy. As a result, I defined product features for the first-generation MVP by leveraging insights from in-depth interviews and an online survey with hobbyist beekeepers across the U.S.

item.title: Tenzing: Documenting Contributions in Academic Research
item.content:encoded:
Project Summary

During my part-time internship as a User Researcher at ChaiOne, Inc. in fall 2020, I led a client project for Tenzing, a web-app for academic researchers from end-to end including research planning, execution and delivering insights.

The project was divided into two parts. For the present case study, I would like to focus on the evaluative research of this project, in which I evaluated usability of the web-app, delivered impactful insights, and worked with designer to deliver design solutions for the client.
